content: <@194432762315407360> ðŸ¤” more... `rlp([rlp(byteArray), rlp(byteArray)])` is **not** the same as `rlp([byteArray, byteArray])`, which I think is why the current syntax bothers me.

author: sky.cactus
content: If you were to execute the former, the inner `rlp(byteArray)` would spit out a new byte array with 1-5 leading RLP bytes.  Then when you do the outer encoding of the `rlp([encodedByteArray, encodedByteArray])` you would encode each already encoded byte array *again*.

author: sky.cactus
content: IIRC, we actually had someone implement exactly this for 2930, because they read somewhere that the transaction is "RLP encoded as a byte array", which they then threw into a list that was later RLP encoded, thus giving them the wrong result.
